frqParts.text: Let g be a continuous function with g(2) = 5. The graph of the piecewise-linear function g', the derivative of g, is shown above for −3 ≤ x ≤ 7. (a) Find the x-coordinate of all points of inflection of the graph of y = g(x) for -3 < x < 7. Justify your answer.
(b) Find the absolute maximum value of g on the interval −3 ≤ x ≤ 7. Justify your answer.
(c) Find the average rate of change of g(x) on the interval −3 ≤ x ≤ 7.

(d) Find the average rate of change of g'(x) on the interval −3 ≤ x ≤ 7. Does the Mean Value Theorem applied on the interval −3 ≤ x ≤ 7 guarantee a value of c, for -3 < c < 7, such that g''(c) is equal to this average rate of change? Why or why not?
